trans-unit.source: How to Use Twilio for Voice and SMS (Java) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Use Twilio for Voice and SMS (Java) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to make a phone call and send a SMS message with the Twilio API service on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to make a phone call and send a SMS message with the Twilio API service on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Code samples written in Java.
trans-unit.target: Code samples written in Java.

trans-unit.source: How to Use Twilio for Voice and SMS Capabilities in Java
trans-unit.target: How to Use Twilio for Voice and SMS Capabilities in Java

trans-unit.source: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the Twilio API service on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the Twilio API service on Azure.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include making a phone call and sending a Short Message Service (SMS) message.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include making a phone call and sending a Short Message Service (SMS) message.

trans-unit.source: For more information on Twilio and using voice and SMS in your applications, see the [Next Steps](#NextSteps) section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on Twilio and using voice and SMS in your applications, see the [Next Steps](#NextSteps) section.

trans-unit.source: What is Twilio?
trans-unit.target: What is Twilio?

trans-unit.source: Twilio is a telephony web-service API that lets you use your existing web languages and skills to build voice and SMS applications.
trans-unit.target: Twilio is a telephony web-service API that lets you use your existing web languages and skills to build voice and SMS applications.

trans-unit.source: Twilio is a third-party service (not an Azure feature and not a Microsoft product).
trans-unit.target: Twilio is a third-party service (not an Azure feature and not a Microsoft product).

trans-unit.source: **Twilio Voice** allows your applications to make and receive phone calls.
trans-unit.target: **Twilio Voice** allows your applications to make and receive phone calls.

trans-unit.source: **Twilio SMS** allows your applications to make and receive SMS messages.
trans-unit.target: **Twilio SMS** allows your applications to make and receive SMS messages.

trans-unit.source: **Twilio Client** allows your applications to enable voice communication using existing Internet connections, including mobile connections.
trans-unit.target: **Twilio Client** allows your applications to enable voice communication using existing Internet connections, including mobile connections.

trans-unit.source: Twilio Pricing and Special Offers
trans-unit.target: Twilio Pricing and Special Offers

trans-unit.source: Information about Twilio pricing is available at [Twilio Pricing] [twilio_pricing].
trans-unit.target: Information about Twilio pricing is available at [Twilio Pricing] [twilio_pricing].

trans-unit.source: Azure customers receive a [special offer][special_offer]: a free credit of 1000 texts or 1000 inbound minutes.
trans-unit.target: Azure customers receive a [special offer][special_offer]: a free credit of 1000 texts or 1000 inbound minutes.

trans-unit.source: To sign up for this offer or get more information, please visit [http://ahoy.twilio.com/azure][special_offer].
trans-unit.target: To sign up for this offer or get more information, please visit [http://ahoy.twilio.com/azure][special_offer].

trans-unit.source: Concepts
trans-unit.target: Concepts

trans-unit.source: The Twilio API is a RESTful API that provides voice and SMS functionality for applications.
trans-unit.target: The Twilio API is a RESTful API that provides voice and SMS functionality for applications.

trans-unit.source: Client libraries are available in multiple languages; for a list, see [Twilio API Libraries] [twilio_libraries].
trans-unit.target: Client libraries are available in multiple languages; for a list, see [Twilio API Libraries] [twilio_libraries].

trans-unit.source: Key aspects of the Twilio API are Twilio verbs and Twilio Markup Language (TwiML).
trans-unit.target: Key aspects of the Twilio API are Twilio verbs and Twilio Markup Language (TwiML).

trans-unit.source: Twilio Verbs
trans-unit.target: Twilio Verbs

trans-unit.source: The API makes use of Twilio verbs; for example, the **<Say>** verb instructs Twilio to audibly deliver a message on a call.
trans-unit.target: The API makes use of Twilio verbs; for example, the **<Say>** verb instructs Twilio to audibly deliver a message on a call.

trans-unit.source: The following is a list of Twilio verbs.
trans-unit.target: The following is a list of Twilio verbs.

trans-unit.source: **<Dial>**: Connects the caller to another phone.
trans-unit.target: **<Dial>**: Connects the caller to another phone.

trans-unit.source: **<Gather>**: Collects numeric digits entered on the telephone keypad.
trans-unit.target: **<Gather>**: Collects numeric digits entered on the telephone keypad.

trans-unit.source: **<Hangup>**: Ends a call.
trans-unit.target: **<Hangup>**: Ends a call.

trans-unit.source: **<Play>**: Plays an audio file.
trans-unit.target: **<Play>**: Plays an audio file.

trans-unit.source: **<Pause>**: Waits silently for a specified number of seconds.
trans-unit.target: **<Pause>**: Waits silently for a specified number of seconds.

trans-unit.source: **<Record>**: Records the caller's voice and returns a URL of a file that contains the recording.
trans-unit.target: **<Record>**: Records the caller's voice and returns a URL of a file that contains the recording.

trans-unit.source: **<Redirect>**: Transfers control of a call or SMS to the TwiML at a different URL.
trans-unit.target: **<Redirect>**: Transfers control of a call or SMS to the TwiML at a different URL.

trans-unit.source: **<Reject>**: Rejects an incoming call to your Twilio number without billing you
trans-unit.target: **<Reject>**: Rejects an incoming call to your Twilio number without billing you

trans-unit.source: **<Say>**: Converts text to speech that is made on a call.
trans-unit.target: **<Say>**: Converts text to speech that is made on a call.

trans-unit.source: **<Sms>**: Sends an SMS message.
trans-unit.target: **<Sms>**: Sends an SMS message.

trans-unit.source: TwiML
trans-unit.target: TwiML

trans-unit.source: TwiML is a set of XML-based instructions based on the Twilio verbs that inform Twilio of how to process a call or SMS.
trans-unit.target: TwiML is a set of XML-based instructions based on the Twilio verbs that inform Twilio of how to process a call or SMS.

trans-unit.source: As an example, the following TwiML would convert the text **Hello World** to speech.
trans-unit.target: As an example, the following TwiML would convert the text **Hello World** to speech.

trans-unit.source: When your application calls the Twilio API, one of the API parameters is the URL that returns the TwiML response.
trans-unit.target: When your application calls the Twilio API, one of the API parameters is the URL that returns the TwiML response.

trans-unit.source: For development purposes, you can use Twilio-provided URLs to provide the TwiML responses used by your applications.
trans-unit.target: For development purposes, you can use Twilio-provided URLs to provide the TwiML responses used by your applications.

trans-unit.source: You could also host your own URLs to produce the TwiML responses, and another option is to use the **TwiMLResponse** object.
trans-unit.target: You could also host your own URLs to produce the TwiML responses, and another option is to use the **TwiMLResponse** object.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Twilio verbs, their attributes, and TwiML, see [TwiML] [twiml].
trans-unit.target: For more information about Twilio verbs, their attributes, and TwiML, see [TwiML] [twiml].

trans-unit.source: For additional information about the Twilio API, see [Twilio API] [twilio_api].
trans-unit.target: For additional information about the Twilio API, see [Twilio API] [twilio_api].

trans-unit.source: Create a Twilio Account
trans-unit.target: Create a Twilio Account

trans-unit.source: When you're ready to get a Twilio account, sign up at [Try Twilio] [try_twilio].
trans-unit.target: When you're ready to get a Twilio account, sign up at [Try Twilio] [try_twilio].

trans-unit.source: You can start with a free account, and upgrade your account later.
trans-unit.target: You can start with a free account, and upgrade your account later.

trans-unit.source: When you sign up for a Twilio account, you'll receive an account ID and an authentication token.
trans-unit.target: When you sign up for a Twilio account, you'll receive an account ID and an authentication token.

trans-unit.source: Both will be needed to make Twilio API calls.
trans-unit.target: Both will be needed to make Twilio API calls.

trans-unit.source: To prevent unauthorized access to your account, keep your authentication token secure.
trans-unit.target: To prevent unauthorized access to your account, keep your authentication token secure.

trans-unit.source: Your account ID and authentication token are viewable at the [Twilio account page] [twilio_account], in the fields labeled **ACCOUNT SID** and **AUTH TOKEN**, respectively.
trans-unit.target: Your account ID and authentication token are viewable at the [Twilio account page] [twilio_account], in the fields labeled **ACCOUNT SID** and **AUTH TOKEN**, respectively.

trans-unit.source: Create a Java Application
trans-unit.target: Create a Java Application

trans-unit.source: Obtain the Twilio JAR and add it to your Java build path and your WAR deployment assembly.
trans-unit.target: Obtain the Twilio JAR and add it to your Java build path and your WAR deployment assembly.

trans-unit.source: At [https://github.com/twilio/twilio-java][twilio_java], you can download the GitHub sources and create your own JAR, or download a pre-built JAR (with or without dependencies).
trans-unit.target: At [https://github.com/twilio/twilio-java][twilio_java], you can download the GitHub sources and create your own JAR, or download a pre-built JAR (with or without dependencies).

trans-unit.source: Ensure your JDK's **cacerts** keystore contains the Equifax Secure Certificate Authority certificate with MD5 fingerprint 67:CB:9D:C0:13:24:8A:82:9B:B2:17:1E:D1:1B:EC:D4 (the serial number is 35:DE:F4:CF and the SHA1 fingerprint is D2:32:09:AD:23:D3:14:23:21:74:E4:0D:7F:9D:62:13:97:86:63:3A).
trans-unit.target: Ensure your JDK's **cacerts** keystore contains the Equifax Secure Certificate Authority certificate with MD5 fingerprint 67:CB:9D:C0:13:24:8A:82:9B:B2:17:1E:D1:1B:EC:D4 (the serial number is 35:DE:F4:CF and the SHA1 fingerprint is D2:32:09:AD:23:D3:14:23:21:74:E4:0D:7F:9D:62:13:97:86:63:3A).

trans-unit.source: This is the certificate authority (CA) certificate for the [https://api.twilio.com][twilio_api_service] service, which is called when you use Twilio APIs.
trans-unit.target: This is the certificate authority (CA) certificate for the [https://api.twilio.com][twilio_api_service] service, which is called when you use Twilio APIs.

trans-unit.source: For information about ensuring your JDK's **cacerts** keystore contains the correct CA certificate, see [Adding a Certificate to the Java CA Certificate Store][add_ca_cert].
trans-unit.target: For information about ensuring your JDK's **cacerts** keystore contains the correct CA certificate, see [Adding a Certificate to the Java CA Certificate Store][add_ca_cert].

trans-unit.source: Detailed instructions for using the Twilio client library for Java are available at [How to Make a Phone Call Using Twilio in a Java Application on Azure][howto_phonecall_java].
trans-unit.target: Detailed instructions for using the Twilio client library for Java are available at [How to Make a Phone Call Using Twilio in a Java Application on Azure][howto_phonecall_java].

trans-unit.source: Configure Your Application to Use Twilio Libraries
trans-unit.target: Configure Your Application to Use Twilio Libraries

trans-unit.source: Within your code, you can add **import** statements at the top of your source files for the Twilio packages or classes you want to use in your application.
trans-unit.target: Within your code, you can add **import** statements at the top of your source files for the Twilio packages or classes you want to use in your application.

trans-unit.source: For Java source files:
trans-unit.target: For Java source files:

trans-unit.source: For Java Server Page (JSP) source files:
trans-unit.target: For Java Server Page (JSP) source files:

trans-unit.source: Depending on which Twilio packages or classes you want to use, your **import** statements may be different.
trans-unit.target: Depending on which Twilio packages or classes you want to use, your **import** statements may be different.

trans-unit.source: How to: Make an outgoing call
trans-unit.target: How to: Make an outgoing call

trans-unit.source: The following shows how to make an outgoing call using the **CallFactory** class.
trans-unit.target: The following shows how to make an outgoing call using the **CallFactory** class.

trans-unit.source: This code also uses a Twilio-provided site to return the Twilio Markup Language (TwiML) response.
trans-unit.target: This code also uses a Twilio-provided site to return the Twilio Markup Language (TwiML) response.

trans-unit.source: Substitute your values for the **From** and **To** phone numbers, and ensure that you verify the **From** phone number for your Twilio account prior to running the code.
trans-unit.target: Substitute your values for the **From** and **To** phone numbers, and ensure that you verify the **From** phone number for your Twilio account prior to running the code.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the parameters passed in to the **CallFactory.create** method, see [http://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/making-calls][twilio_rest_making_calls].
trans-unit.target: For more information about the parameters passed in to the **CallFactory.create** method, see [http://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/making-calls][twilio_rest_making_calls].

trans-unit.source: As mentioned, this code uses a Twilio-provided site to return the TwiML response.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned, this code uses a Twilio-provided site to return the TwiML response.

trans-unit.source: You could instead use your own site to provide the TwiML response; for more information, see [How to Provide TwiML Responses in a Java Application on Azure](#howto_provide_twiml_responses).
trans-unit.target: You could instead use your own site to provide the TwiML response; for more information, see [How to Provide TwiML Responses in a Java Application on Azure](#howto_provide_twiml_responses).

trans-unit.source: How to: Send an SMS message
trans-unit.target: How to: Send an SMS message

trans-unit.source: The following shows how to send an SMS message using the **SmsFactory** class.
trans-unit.target: The following shows how to send an SMS message using the **SmsFactory** class.

trans-unit.source: The **From** number, **4155992671**, is provided by Twilio for trial accounts to send SMS messages.
trans-unit.target: The **From** number, **4155992671**, is provided by Twilio for trial accounts to send SMS messages.

trans-unit.source: The **To** number must be verified for your Twilio account prior to running the code.
trans-unit.target: The **To** number must be verified for your Twilio account prior to running the code.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the parameters passed in to the **SmsFactory.create** method, see [http://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/sending-sms][twilio_rest_sending_sms].
trans-unit.target: For more information about the parameters passed in to the **SmsFactory.create** method, see [http://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/sending-sms][twilio_rest_sending_sms].

trans-unit.source: How to: Provide TwiML Responses from your own Website
trans-unit.target: How to: Provide TwiML Responses from your own Website

trans-unit.source: When your application initiates a call to the Twilio API, for example via the **CallFactory.create** method, Twilio will send your request to a URL that is expected to return a TwiML response.
trans-unit.target: When your application initiates a call to the Twilio API, for example via the **CallFactory.create** method, Twilio will send your request to a URL that is expected to return a TwiML response.

trans-unit.source: The example above uses the Twilio-provided URL [http://twimlets.com/message][twimlet_message_url].
trans-unit.target: The example above uses the Twilio-provided URL [http://twimlets.com/message][twimlet_message_url].

trans-unit.source: (While TwiML is designed for use by Web services, you can view the TwiML in your browser.
trans-unit.target: (While TwiML is designed for use by Web services, you can view the TwiML in your browser.

trans-unit.source: For example, click [http://twimlets.com/message][twimlet_message_url] to see an empty **<Response>** element; as another example, click [http://twimlets.com/message?Message%5B0%5D=Hello%20World][twimlet_message_url_hello_world] to see a **<Response>** element that contains a **<Say>** element.)
trans-unit.target: For example, click [http://twimlets.com/message][twimlet_message_url] to see an empty **<Response>** element; as another example, click [http://twimlets.com/message?Message%5B0%5D=Hello%20World][twimlet_message_url_hello_world] to see a **<Response>** element that contains a **<Say>** element.)

trans-unit.source: Instead of relying on the Twilio-provided URL, you can create your own URL site that returns HTTP responses.
trans-unit.target: Instead of relying on the Twilio-provided URL, you can create your own URL site that returns HTTP responses.

trans-unit.source: You can create the site in any language that returns HTTP responses; this topic assumes you'll be hosting the URL in a JSP page.
trans-unit.target: You can create the site in any language that returns HTTP responses; this topic assumes you'll be hosting the URL in a JSP page.

trans-unit.source: The following JSP page results in a TwiML response that says **Hello World** on the call.
trans-unit.target: The following JSP page results in a TwiML response that says **Hello World** on the call.

trans-unit.source: The following JSP page results in a TwiML response that says some text, has several pauses, and says information about the Twilio API version and the Azure role name.
trans-unit.target: The following JSP page results in a TwiML response that says some text, has several pauses, and says information about the Twilio API version and the Azure role name.

trans-unit.source: The **ApiVersion** parameter is available in Twilio voice requests (not SMS requests).
trans-unit.target: The **ApiVersion** parameter is available in Twilio voice requests (not SMS requests).

trans-unit.source: To see the available request parameters for Twilio voice and SMS requests, see <https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/twiml/twilio_request> and <https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/twiml/sms/twilio_request>, respectively.
trans-unit.target: To see the available request parameters for Twilio voice and SMS requests, see <https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/twiml/twilio_request> and <https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/twiml/sms/twilio_request>, respectively.

trans-unit.source: The **RoleName** environment variable is available as part of an Azure deployment.
trans-unit.target: The **RoleName** environment variable is available as part of an Azure deployment.

trans-unit.source: (If you want to add custom environment variables so they could be picked up from **System.getenv**, see the environment variables section at [Miscellaneous Role Configuration Settings][misc_role_config_settings].)
trans-unit.target: (If you want to add custom environment variables so they could be picked up from **System.getenv**, see the environment variables section at [Miscellaneous Role Configuration Settings][misc_role_config_settings].)

trans-unit.source: Once you have your JSP page set up to provide TwiML responses, use the URL of the JSP page as the URL passed into the **CallFactory.create** method.
trans-unit.target: Once you have your JSP page set up to provide TwiML responses, use the URL of the JSP page as the URL passed into the **CallFactory.create** method.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have a Web application named MyTwiML deployed to an Azure hosted service, and the name of the JSP page is mytwiml.jsp, the URL can be passed to **CallFactory.create** as shown in the following:
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have a Web application named MyTwiML deployed to an Azure hosted service, and the name of the JSP page is mytwiml.jsp, the URL can be passed to **CallFactory.create** as shown in the following:

trans-unit.source: Another option for responding with TwiML is via the **TwiMLResponse** class, which is available in the **com.twilio.sdk.verbs** package.
trans-unit.target: Another option for responding with TwiML is via the **TwiMLResponse** class, which is available in the **com.twilio.sdk.verbs** package.

trans-unit.source: For additional information about using Twilio in Azure with Java, see [How to Make a Phone Call Using Twilio in a Java Application on Azure][howto_phonecall_java].
trans-unit.target: For additional information about using Twilio in Azure with Java, see [How to Make a Phone Call Using Twilio in a Java Application on Azure][howto_phonecall_java].

trans-unit.source: How to: Use Additional Twilio Services
trans-unit.target: How to: Use Additional Twilio Services

trans-unit.source: In addition to the examples shown here, Twilio offers web-based APIs that you can use to leverage additional Twilio functionality from your Azure application.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the examples shown here, Twilio offers web-based APIs that you can use to leverage additional Twilio functionality from your Azure application.

trans-unit.source: For full details, see the [Twilio API documentation] [twilio_api_documentation].
trans-unit.target: For full details, see the [Twilio API documentation] [twilio_api_documentation].
